thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho makes thinly-veiled dig at Jurgen Klopp over showing ‘respect’ to the FA Cup – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho makes thinly-veiled dig at Jurgen Klopp over showing ‘respect’ to the FA Cup
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho makes thinly-veiled dig at Jurgen Klopp over showing ‘respect’ to the FA Cup

author: Sean Kearns
title: Jose Mourinho makes thinly-veiled dig at Jurgen Klopp over showing ‘respect’ to the FA Cup
text:
Jose Mourinho insists he’ll respect the FA Cup on Sunday (Picture: Getty) Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho has aimed a sly dig at Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp by claiming some foreign Premier League bosses don’t respect the FA Cup.
Liverpool were knocked out in the fourth round at home to Championship side Wolves in January when they lost 2-1.
Don't hire Howe! A five-point plan for Arsenal to rebuild after Wenger Mourinho’s men take on Blackburn at Ewood Park on Sunday with the 54-year-old looking to lay his hands on the trophy for the second time after victory with Chelsea in 2007.
The Portuguese has promised to field a strong side on the weekend but he insists – without naming names – that some foreign bosses don’t understand the importance of the competition.
Liverpool were humiliated by Wolves at home (Picture: Getty) ‘Maybe we don’t have as many managers in England with that culture as we should,’ said Mourinho.
‘Maybe we foreign managers, not everybody studies and understands the culture of this country. It’s because of attitude. Because you think it’s easy – and it’s not easy.’
United are favourites to progress to the quarter-finals on Sunday but Mourinho insists he won’t be taking Blackburn lightly and will field a strong team.
‘With Chelsea, I lost against a League One or League Two team, but I never threw it away,’ insisted Mourinho.
‘So I always try to go serious. I like Wembley. I like the FA Cup. So I have to try to get the second one.’
MORE: Manchester United could do a Paul Pogba and re-sign Michael Keane, says Rio Ferdinand
